entry.title: Project Summary
entry.content:
Introduction:

Relevant research and analysis on MOSFET(METAL-OXIDE-SEMICONDUCTOR FIELD-EFFECT TRANSISTOR), based on fundamental function and structure of MOSFET. Then build p-type MOSFET in COMSOL MULTIPHYSICS and do relevant analysis.

Experimental target:

(1)learn basic knowledge of semiconductor

（a）Electron bands

（b）Hole bands

（c）Function of Doping

   (d) Characteristics of diode

(2)understand function and structure of MOSFET

(3)build the model of MOSFET and analyze

Methods:

(1)Application of two software(COMSOL and MATLAB)

(2)Searching unknown relevant knowledge on the Internet

(3)Learning to ask “Why” , brainstorming independently and finding the solution to the problems.

Experimental process1–build the model of diode in COMSOL:

Step1:setting basic parameters

NameExpressionDescription
Vabias*sweepApplied voltage
TI300[K]Lattic temperature
Na1e15[1/cm^3]Acceptor concentration
Nd1e15[1/cm^3]Donor concentration
epsilonr_param11.8Relative permittivity
Eg0_param1.12[V]Band gap
chi0_param4.05[V]Electron affinity
Ni1.25e10[1/cm^3]Intrinsic carrier concentration
Nc_paramNi*exp(Eg0_param*e_const/(2*k_B_const*TI))Conduction band density of states
Nv_paramNi*exp(Eg0_param*e_const/(2*k_B_const*TI))Valence band density of states
taun_param1e-6[s]Electron lifetime
taup_paramtaun_paramHole lifetime
bias-4[V]Device bias
sweep1Sweep parameter for gradually turning on bias

Step2:build diode model (1D)

Step3:results–carrier concentration(semi) with various voltage[-1V~1V]

Line Graph:Electron concentration(1/cm3)
Line Graph:Hole concentration(1/cm3)
![2.jpg](Project-Summary/2.png)

Step4:research V-I graph in MATLAB

Plot graph1:

Plot graph2:

Experimental process2–build the model of MOSFET in COMSOL:

Step1:setting basic parameter in advanced.

NameExpressionDescription
Chi_ox4.1[V]Work function of oxide
D_B_Doping0.1[um]Depth of doping in base region
D_B_junction_xD_S_junction_xJunction depth of base region in x-direction
D_B_junction_yD_S_junction_yJunction depth of base region in y-direction
D_D_Doping0.1[um]Depth of doping in drain region
D_D_junction_xD_S_junction_xJunction depth of drain region in x-direction
D_D_junction_yD_S_junction_yJunction depth of drain region in y-direction
d_ox30[nm]Thickness of oxide
D_S_Doping0.1[um]Depth of doping in source region
D_S_junction_x0.2[um]Junction depth of source region in x-direction
D_S_junction_y0.25[um]Junction depth of source region in y-direction
D_total0.7[um]Total depth
D_Well0.35[um]Depth of the well
D_Well_junction0.35[um]
epsilon_ox4.5Relative permittivity of oxide layer
N_B1e20[1/cm^3]Base region doping
N_background1e17[1/cm^3]Background p-doping
N_D1e20[1/cm^3]Drain region doping
N_S1e20[1/cm^3]Source region doping
N_WellN_background*2Well region doping
V_BV_SBase voltage
V_D-10[mV]Drain voltage
V_G-1[V]Gate voltage
V_S0[V]Source voltage
W_BW_SWidth of base contact
W_B_Doping0.6[um]Width of drain contact
W_DW_SWidth of doping in drain region
W_D_Doping0.6[um]Width of doping in drain region
W_G1.6[um]Width of gate contact
W_gap_BS1[um]Width between base
W_gap_GD0.2[um]Width between gate an
W_gap_SG0.2[um]Width between source
W_S0.5[um]Width of source contact
W_S_Doping0.6[um]Width of doping in source
W_totalW_B+W_gap_BS+W_S+W_gap_SG+W_G+W_gap_GD+W_DTotal width

Step2:create model based on following graph to create p-type MOSFET

Completed MOSFET model

Step3:regulate all needed area

For instance(Continuity):

Step4:set Mash-size

Step5:get results hole concentration (with V_G=-1V)

As can be seen from the above graph, p-type area has higher hole concentration, whereas, n-type area has low hole concentration.

Then I focused on researching the electron concentration below gate with different voltage across the gate. So, firstly, V-I graph could be gained from this semiconductor.

As can be inferred from the above graph, this MOSFET could allow the flow of current between the voltage -3V and -2V

In the range of voltage(-1V~1V), It could be observed the electron concentration below the gate with different voltage.

When V_G = -1V
It could be observed clearly that it had no channel between two p-type areas below the gate, so it had no current.

When voltage=-2V,it could be observed that it has a thin channel which has high hole concentration,this MOSFET could have electricity under this voltage.

Challenges

(1)The utilization of unfamiliar software to solve problems.

(1) Using complicated mathematics to solve practical problems.

(2) Use limited time and courses to learn and apply the knowledge of MOSFET as much as possible.

How did I overcome them

(1)When facing with unfamiliar programs I have never learned
before, I read the programs word for word and tried my best to understand the meaning and function of each part. I also debug the error feedback through searching the methods online. I do develop the ability to get the answer to the question on my own and build the confidence to continue studying in this field.

(2)Besides, when I came across some difficulties other than programming, I would research relevant knowledge on the internet, it is the most efficient way for me to solve it.

(3) I also read some relevant reference books to broaden my physical knowledge like (The Feynman lectures on physics, especially for the Volume

What was the most interesting part of my project?

When I met some physical quantities and formulas to the software COMSOL, all of these data plotted to physical model and mathematical graph. I could observe the shape in different dimension, which was helpful for me to understand more clearly for the properties of MOSFET. What’s more, the software of MATLAB could transfer the detailed physical data to more clear and accurate graphs. From these two software, I have seen how powerful for people to use these advanced applicants to solve problems. Besides, object of the image indeed could bring more interests to me to study and understand.

Through working on this project, I have learned how to do self study and got the spirit to say ’why’ for every problems or situations and the confidence to figure them out . These methods would be helpful not only for my academic abilities,but also be useful tools to do almost everything , and I also look forward to exploring more in the field of electrical engineering.

Click here to download my data file
